form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Thune (for himself, Mr. McConnell, Mr. Vitter, Mr. Cornyn, Mr. Inhofe, Mr. Roberts, Mr. Wicker, Mrs. Fischer, Mr. Flake, Mr. Blunt, Mr. Coats, Mr. Johanns, and Mr. Boozman) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To improve the establishment of any lower ground-level ozone standards, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Clean Air, Strong Economies Act
or the
CASE Act
.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law (including regulations), in promulgating a national primary or secondary ambient air quality standard for ozone, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agencyâ€”

paragraph.text: shall not propose a national primary or secondary ambient air quality standard for ozone that is lower than the standard established under section 50.15 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on January 1, 2014), until at least 85 percent of the counties that were nonattainment areas under that standard as of January 1, 2014, achieve full compliance with that standard;
shall take into consideration feasibility and cost; and

shall include in the regulatory impact analysis for the proposed and final rule at least 1 analysis that does not include any calculation of benefits resulting from reducing emissions of any pollutant other than ozone.
